text: To Sherlock Holmes she is always THE woman. I have seldom heard
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: him mention her under any other name. In his eyes she eclipses
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and predominates the whole of her sex. It was not that he felt
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: any emotion akin to love for Irene Adler. All emotions, and that
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: one particularly, were abhorrent to his cold, precise but
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: admirably balanced mind. He was, I take it, the most perfect
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: reasoning and observing machine that the world has seen, but as a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: lover he would have placed himself in a false position. He never
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: spoke of the softer passions, save with a gibe and a sneer. They
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: were admirable things for the observer--excellent for drawing the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: veil from men's motives and actions. But for the trained reasoner
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to admit such intrusions into his own delicate and finely
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: adjusted temperament was to introduce a distracting factor which
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: might throw a doubt upon all his mental results. Grit in a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sensitive instrument, or a crack in one of his own high-power
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: lenses, would not be more disturbing than a strong emotion in a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: nature such as his. And yet there was but one woman to him, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: that woman was the late Irene Adler, of dubious and questionable
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: memory.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: finds himself master of his own establishment, were sufficient to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: absorb all my attention, while Holmes, who loathed every form of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: society with his whole Bohemian soul, remained in our lodgings in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: week to week between cocaine and ambition, the drowsiness of the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: drug, and the fierce energy of his own keen nature. He was still,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: as ever, deeply attracted by the study of crime, and occupied his
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: immense faculties and extraordinary powers of observation in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: following out those clues, and clearing up those mysteries which
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: had been abandoned as hopeless by the official police. From time

text: to Odessa in the case of the Trepoff murder, of his clearing up

text: of the singular tragedy of the Atkinson brothers at Trincomalee,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and finally of the mission which he had accomplished so
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: delicately and successfully for the reigning family of Holland.

text: One night--it was on the twentieth of March, 1888--I was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: passed the well-remembered door, which must always be associated
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: in my mind with my wooing, and with the dark incidents of the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Study in Scarlet, I was seized with a keen desire to see Holmes
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: again, and to know how he was employing his extraordinary powers.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: his tall, spare figure pass twice in a dark silhouette against
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the blind. He was pacing the room swiftly, eagerly, with his head
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sunk upon his chest and his hands clasped behind him. To me, who
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: knew his every mood and habit, his attitude and manner told their
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: own story. He was at work again. He had risen out of his
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: drug-created dreams and was hot upon the scent of some new
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: problem. I rang the bell and was shown up to the chamber which
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: had formerly been in part my own.

text: think, to see me. With hardly a word spoken, but with a kindly
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: eye, he waved me to an armchair, threw across his case of cigars,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and indicated a spirit case and a gasogene in the corner. Then he
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: stood before the fire and looked me over in his singular
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: introspective fashion.

ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: out."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: quarters received. Be in your chamber then at that hour, and do
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: not take it amiss if your visitor wear a mask."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I then lounged down the street and found, as I expected, that
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: there was a mews in a lane which runs down by one wall of the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: garden. I lent the ostlers a hand in rubbing down their horses,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and received in exchange twopence, a glass of half and half, two
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: fills of shag tobacco, and as much information as I could desire
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: about Miss Adler, to say nothing of half a dozen other people in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the neighbourhood in whom I was not in the least interested, but
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: whose biographies I was compelled to listen to."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And what of Irene Adler?" I asked.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Oh, she has turned all the men's heads down in that part. She is
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the daintiest thing under a bonnet on this planet. So say the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Serpentine-mews, to a man. She lives quietly, sings at concerts,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: drives out at five every day, and returns at seven sharp for
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: dinner. Seldom goes out at other times, except when she sings.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Has only one male visitor, but a good deal of him. He is dark,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: handsome, and dashing, never calls less than once a day, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: often twice. He is a Mr. Godfrey Norton, of the Inner Temple. See
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the advantages of a cabman as a confidant. They had driven him
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: home a dozen times from Serpentine-mews, and knew all about him.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: When I had listened to all they had to tell, I began to walk up
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and down near Briony Lodge once more, and to think over my plan
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of campaign.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "This Godfrey Norton was evidently an important factor in the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: matter. He was a lawyer. That sounded ominous. What was the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: relation between them, and what the object of his repeated
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: visits? Was she his client, his friend, or his mistress? If the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: former, she had probably transferred the photograph to his
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: keeping. If the latter, it was less likely. On the issue of this
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: question depended whether I should continue my work at Briony
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Lodge, or turn my attention to the gentleman's chambers in the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Temple. It was a delicate point, and it widened the field of my
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: inquiry. I fear that I bore you with these details, but I have to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: let you see my little difficulties, if you are to understand the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: situation."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am following you closely," I answered.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I was still balancing the matter in my mind when a hansom cab
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: drove up to Briony Lodge, and a gentleman sprang out. He was a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: remarkably handsome man, dark, aquiline, and moustached--evidently
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the man of whom I had heard. He appeared to be in a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: great hurry, shouted to the cabman to wait, and brushed past the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: maid who opened the door with the air of a man who was thoroughly
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: at home.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "He was in the house about half an hour, and I could catch
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: glimpses of him in the windows of the sitting-room, pacing up and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: down, talking excitedly, and waving his arms. Of her I could see
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: nothing. Presently he emerged, looking even more flurried than
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: before. As he stepped up to the cab, he pulled a gold watch from
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: his pocket and looked at it earnestly, 'Drive like the devil,' he
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: shouted, 'first to Gross & Hankey's in Regent Street, and then to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the Church of St. Monica in the Edgeware Road. Half a guinea if
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: you do it in twenty minutes!'
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Away they went, and I was just wondering whether I should not do
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: well to follow them when up the lane came a neat little landau,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the coachman with his coat only half-buttoned, and his tie under
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: his ear, while all the tags of his harness were sticking out of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the buckles. It hadn't pulled up before she shot out of the hall
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: door and into it. I only caught a glimpse of her at the moment,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: but she was a lovely woman, with a face that a man might die for.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "'The Church of St. Monica, John,' she cried, 'and half a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sovereign if you reach it in twenty minutes.'
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "This was quite too good to lose, Watson. I was just balancing
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: whether I should run for it, or whether I should perch behind her
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: landau when a cab came through the street. The driver looked
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: twice at such a shabby fare, but I jumped in before he could
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: object. 'The Church of St. Monica,' said I, 'and half a sovereign
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: if you reach it in twenty minutes.' It was twenty-five minutes to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: twelve, and of course it was clear enough what was in the wind.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "My cabby drove fast. I don't think I ever drove faster, but the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: others were there before us. The cab and the landau with their
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: steaming horses were in front of the door when I arrived. I paid
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the man and hurried into the church. There was not a soul there
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: save the two whom I had followed and a surpliced clergyman, who
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: seemed to be expostulating with them. They were all three
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: standing in a knot in front of the altar. I lounged up the side
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: aisle like any other idler who has dropped into a church.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Suddenly, to my surprise, the three at the altar faced round to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: me, and Godfrey Norton came running as hard as he could towards
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: me.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "'Thank God,' he cried. 'You'll do. Come! Come!'
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "'What then?' I asked.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "'Come, man, come, only three minutes, or it won't be legal.'
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I was half-dragged up to the altar, and before I knew where I was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: I found myself mumbling responses which were whispered in my ear,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and vouching for things of which I knew nothing, and generally
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: assisting in the secure tying up of Irene Adler, spinster, to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Godfrey Norton, bachelor. It was all done in an instant, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: there was the gentleman thanking me on the one side and the lady
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: on the other, while the clergyman beamed on me in front. It was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the most preposterous position in which I ever found myself in my
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: life, and it was the thought of it that started me laughing just
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: now. It seems that there had been some informality about their
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: license, that the clergyman absolutely refused to marry them
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: without a witness of some sort, and that my lucky appearance
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: saved the bridegroom from having to sally out into the streets in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: search of a best man. The bride gave me a sovereign, and I mean
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to wear it on my watch-chain in memory of the occasion."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "This is a very unexpected turn of affairs," said I; "and what
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: then?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Well, I found my plans very seriously menaced. It looked as if
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the pair might take an immediate departure, and so necessitate
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: very prompt and energetic measures on my part. At the church
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: door, however, they separated, he driving back to the Temple, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: she to her own house. 'I shall drive out in the park at five as
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: usual,' she said as she left him. I heard no more. They drove
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: away in different directions, and I went off to make my own
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: arrangements."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Which are?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Some cold beef and a glass of beer," he answered, ringing the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: bell. "I have been too busy to think of food, and I am likely to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: be busier still this evening. By the way, Doctor, I shall want
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: your co-operation."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I shall be delighted."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You don't mind breaking the law?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Not in the least."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Nor running a chance of arrest?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Not in a good cause."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Oh, the cause is excellent!"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then I am your man."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I was sure that I might rely on you."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But what is it you wish?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "When Mrs. Turner has brought in the tray I will make it clear to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: you. Now," he said as he turned hungrily on the simple fare that
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: our landlady had provided, "I must discuss it while I eat, for I
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: have not much time. It is nearly five now. In two hours we must
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: be on the scene of action. Miss Irene, or Madame, rather, returns
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: from her drive at seven. We must be at Briony Lodge to meet her."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And what then?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You must leave that to me. I have already arranged what is to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: occur. There is only one point on which I must insist. You must
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: not interfere, come what may. You understand?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am to be neutral?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "To do nothing whatever. There will probably be some small
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: unpleasantness. Do not join in it. It will end in my being
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: conveyed into the house. Four or five minutes afterwards the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sitting-room window will open. You are to station yourself close
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to that open window."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Yes."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You are to watch me, for I will be visible to you."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Yes."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And when I raise my hand--so--you will throw into the room what
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: I give you to throw, and will, at the same time, raise the cry of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: fire. You quite follow me?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Entirely."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "It is nothing very formidable," he said, taking a long cigar-shaped
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: roll from his pocket. "It is an ordinary plumber's smoke-rocket,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: fitted with a cap at either end to make it self-lighting.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Your task is confined to that. When you raise your cry of fire,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: it will be taken up by quite a number of people. You may then
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: walk to the end of the street, and I will rejoin you in ten
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: minutes. I hope that I have made myself clear?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am to remain neutral, to get near the window, to watch you,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and at the signal to throw in this object, then to raise the cry
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of fire, and to wait you at the corner of the street."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Precisely."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then you may entirely rely on me."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "That is excellent. I think, perhaps, it is almost time that I
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: prepare for the new role I have to play."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: He disappeared into his bedroom and returned in a few minutes in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the character of an amiable and simple-minded Nonconformist
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: clergyman. His broad black hat, his baggy trousers, his white
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: tie, his sympathetic smile, and general look of peering and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: benevolent curiosity were such as Mr. John Hare alone could have
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: equalled. It was not merely that Holmes changed his costume. His
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: expression, his manner, his very soul seemed to vary with every
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: fresh part that he assumed. The stage lost a fine actor, even as
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: science lost an acute reasoner, when he became a specialist in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: crime.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: It was a quarter past six when we left Baker Street, and it still
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: wanted ten minutes to the hour when we found ourselves in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Serpentine Avenue. It was already dusk, and the lamps were just
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: being lighted as we paced up and down in front of Briony Lodge,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: waiting for the coming of its occupant. The house was just such
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: as I had pictured it from Sherlock Holmes' succinct description,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: but the locality appeared to be less private than I expected. On
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the contrary, for a small street in a quiet neighbourhood, it was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: remarkably animated. There was a group of shabbily dressed men
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: smoking and laughing in a corner, a scissors-grinder with his
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: wheel, two guardsmen who were flirting with a nurse-girl, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: several well-dressed young men who were lounging up and down with
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: cigars in their mouths.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You see," remarked Holmes, as we paced to and fro in front of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the house, "this marriage rather simplifies matters. The
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: photograph becomes a double-edged weapon now. The chances are
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: that she would be as averse to its being seen by Mr. Godfrey
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Norton, as our client is to its coming to the eyes of his
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: princess. Now the question is, Where are we to find the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: photograph?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Where, indeed?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "It is most unlikely that she carries it about with her. It is
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: cabinet size. Too large for easy concealment about a woman's
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: dress. She knows that the King is capable of having her waylaid
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and searched. Two attempts of the sort have already been made. We
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: may take it, then, that she does not carry it about with her."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Where, then?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Her banker or her lawyer. There is that double possibility. But
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: I am inclined to think neither. Women are naturally secretive,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: and they like to do their own secreting. Why should she hand it
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: over to anyone else? She could trust her own guardianship, but
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: she could not tell what indirect or political influence might be
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: brought to bear upon a business man. Besides, remember that she
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: had resolved to use it within a few days. It must be where she
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: can lay her hands upon it. It must be in her own house."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But it has twice been burgled."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Pshaw! They did not know how to look."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But how will you look?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I will not look."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "What then?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I will get her to show me."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But she will refuse."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "She will not be able to. But I hear the rumble of wheels. It is
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: her carriage. Now carry out my orders to the letter."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: As he spoke the gleam of the side-lights of a carriage came round
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the curve of the avenue. It was a smart little landau which
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: rattled up to the door of Briony Lodge. As it pulled up, one of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the loafing men at the corner dashed forward to open the door in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the hope of earning a copper, but was elbowed away by another
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: loafer, who had rushed up with the same intention. A fierce
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: quarrel broke out, which was increased by the two guardsmen, who
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: took sides with one of the loungers, and by the scissors-grinder,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: who was equally hot upon the other side. A blow was struck, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: in an instant the lady, who had stepped from her carriage, was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the centre of a little knot of flushed and struggling men, who
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: struck savagely at each other with their fists and sticks. Holmes
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: dashed into the crowd to protect the lady; but just as he reached
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: her he gave a cry and dropped to the ground, with the blood
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: running freely down his face. At his fall the guardsmen took to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: their heels in one direction and the loungers in the other, while
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: a number of better-dressed people, who had watched the scuffle
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: without taking part in it, crowded in to help the lady and to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: attend to the injured man. Irene Adler, as I will still call her,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: had hurried up the steps; but she stood at the top with her
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: superb figure outlined against the lights of the hall, looking
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: back into the street.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Is the poor gentleman much hurt?" she asked.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "He is dead," cried several voices.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "No, no, there's life in him!" shouted another. "But he'll be
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: gone before you can get him to hospital."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "He's a brave fellow," said a woman. "They would have had the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: lady's purse and watch if it hadn't been for him. They were a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: gang, and a rough one, too. Ah, he's breathing now."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "He can't lie in the street. May we bring him in, marm?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Surely. Bring him into the sitting-room. There is a comfortable
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sofa. This way, please!"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Slowly and solemnly he was borne into Briony Lodge and laid out
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: in the principal room, while I still observed the proceedings
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: from my post by the window. The lamps had been lit, but the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: blinds had not been drawn, so that I could see Holmes as he lay
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: upon the couch. I do not know whether he was seized with
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: compunction at that moment for the part he was playing, but I
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: know that I never felt more heartily ashamed of myself in my life
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: than when I saw the beautiful creature against whom I was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: conspiring, or the grace and kindliness with which she waited
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: upon the injured man. And yet it would be the blackest treachery
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to Holmes to draw back now from the part which he had intrusted
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to me. I hardened my heart, and took the smoke-rocket from under
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: my ulster. After all, I thought, we are not injuring her. We are
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: but preventing her from injuring another.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Holmes had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: who is in need of air. A maid rushed across and threw open the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: window. At the same instant I saw him raise his hand and at the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: signal I tossed my rocket into the room with a cry of "Fire!" The
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: word was no sooner out of my mouth than the whole crowd of
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: spectators, well dressed and ill--gentlemen, ostlers, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: servant-maids--joined in a general shriek of "Fire!" Thick clouds
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of smoke curled through the room and out at the open window. I
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: caught a glimpse of rushing figures, and a moment later the voice
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of Holmes from within assuring them that it was a false alarm.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Slipping through the shouting crowd I made my way to the corner
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of the street, and in ten minutes was rejoiced to find my
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: friend's arm in mine, and to get away from the scene of uproar.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: He walked swiftly and in silence for some few minutes until we
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: had turned down one of the quiet streets which lead towards the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Edgeware Road.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You did it very nicely, Doctor," he remarked. "Nothing could
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: have been better. It is all right."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You have the photograph?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I know where it is."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And how did you find out?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "She showed me, as I told you she would."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am still in the dark."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I do not wish to make a mystery," said he, laughing. "The matter
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: was perfectly simple. You, of course, saw that everyone in the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: street was an accomplice. They were all engaged for the evening."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I guessed as much."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then, when the row broke out, I had a little moist red paint in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the palm of my hand. I rushed forward, fell down, clapped my hand
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to my face, and became a piteous spectacle. It is an old trick."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "That also I could fathom."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then they carried me in. She was bound to have me in. What else
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: could she do? And into her sitting-room, which was the very room
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: which I suspected. It lay between that and her bedroom, and I was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: determined to see which. They laid me on a couch, I motioned for
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: air, they were compelled to open the window, and you had your
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: chance."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "How did that help you?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "It was all-important. When a woman thinks that her house is on
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: fire, her instinct is at once to rush to the thing which she
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: values most. It is a perfectly overpowering impulse, and I have
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: more than once taken advantage of it. In the case of the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Darlington substitution scandal it was of use to me, and also in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the Arnsworth Castle business. A married woman grabs at her baby;
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: an unmarried one reaches for her jewel-box. Now it was clear to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: me that our lady of to-day had nothing in the house more precious
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to her than what we are in quest of. She would rush to secure it.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: The alarm of fire was admirably done. The smoke and shouting were
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: enough to shake nerves of steel. She responded beautifully. The
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: photograph is in a recess behind a sliding panel just above the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: right bell-pull. She was there in an instant, and I caught a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: glimpse of it as she half-drew it out. When I cried out that it
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: was a false alarm, she replaced it, glanced at the rocket, rushed
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: from the room, and I have not seen her since. I rose, and, making
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: my excuses, escaped from the house. I hesitated whether to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: attempt to secure the photograph at once; but the coachman had
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: come in, and as he was watching me narrowly it seemed safer to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: wait. A little over-precipitance may ruin all."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And now?" I asked.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Our quest is practically finished. I shall call with the King
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: to-morrow, and with you, if you care to come with us. We will be
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: shown into the sitting-room to wait for the lady, but it is
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: probable that when she comes she may find neither us nor the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: photograph. It might be a satisfaction to his Majesty to regain
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: it with his own hands."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And when will you call?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "At eight in the morning. She will not be up, so that we shall
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: have a clear field. Besides, we must be prompt, for this marriage
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: may mean a complete change in her life and habits. I must wire to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: the King without delay."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: We had reached Baker Street and had stopped at the door. He was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: searching his pockets for the key when someone passing said:
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Good-night, Mister Sherlock Holmes."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: There were several people on the pavement at the time, but the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: greeting appeared to come from a slim youth in an ulster who had
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: hurried by.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I've heard that voice before," said Holmes, staring down the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: dimly lit street. "Now, I wonder who the deuce that could have
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: been."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: III.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: I slept at Baker Street that night, and we were engaged upon our
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: toast and coffee in the morning when the King of Bohemia rushed
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: into the room.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "You have really got it!" he cried, grasping Sherlock Holmes by
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: either shoulder and looking eagerly into his face.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Not yet."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But you have hopes?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I have hopes."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then, come. I am all impatience to be gone."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "We must have a cab."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "No, my brougham is waiting."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Then that will simplify matters." We descended and started off
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: once more for Briony Lodge.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Irene Adler is married," remarked Holmes.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Married! When?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Yesterday."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But to whom?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "To an English lawyer named Norton."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "But she could not love him."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am in hopes that she does."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And why in hopes?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Because it would spare your Majesty all fear of future
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: annoyance. If the lady loves her husband, she does not love your
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Majesty. If she does not love your Majesty, there is no reason
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: why she should interfere with your Majesty's plan."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "It is true. And yet--Well! I wish she had been of my own
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: station! What a queen she would have made!" He relapsed into a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: moody silence, which was not broken until we drew up in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Serpentine Avenue.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: The door of Briony Lodge was open, and an elderly woman stood
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: upon the steps. She watched us with a sardonic eye as we stepped
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: from the brougham.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Mr. Sherlock Holmes, I believe?" said she.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I am Mr. Holmes," answered my companion, looking at her with a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: questioning and rather startled gaze.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Indeed! My mistress told me that you were likely to call. She
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: left this morning with her husband by the 5:15 train from Charing
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Cross for the Continent."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "What!" Sherlock Holmes staggered back, white with chagrin and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: surprise. "Do you mean that she has left England?"
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Never to return."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "And the papers?" asked the King hoarsely. "All is lost."
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "We shall see." He pushed past the servant and rushed into the
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: drawing-room, followed by the King and myself. The furniture was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: scattered about in every direction, with dismantled shelves and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: open drawers, as if the lady had hurriedly ransacked them before
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: her flight. Holmes rushed at the bell-pull, tore back a small
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: sliding shutter, and, plunging in his hand, pulled out a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: photograph and a letter. The photograph was of Irene Adler
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: herself in evening dress, the letter was superscribed to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Sherlock Holmes, Esq. To be left till called for." My friend
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: tore it open and we all three read it together. It was dated at
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: midnight of the preceding night and ran in this way:
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "MY DEAR MR. SHERLOCK HOLMES,--You really did it very well. You
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: took me in completely. Until after the alarm of fire, I had not a
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: suspicion. But then, when I found how I had betrayed myself, I
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: began to think. I had been warned against you months ago. I had
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: been told that if the King employed an agent it would certainly
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: be you. And your address had been given me. Yet, with all this,
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: you made me reveal what you wanted to know. Even after I became
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: suspicious, I found it hard to think evil of such a dear, kind
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: old clergyman. But, you know, I have been trained as an actress
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: myself. Male costume is nothing new to me. I often take advantage
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: of the freedom which it gives. I sent John, the coachman, to
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: watch you, ran up stairs, got into my walking-clothes, as I call
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: them, and came down just as you departed.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Well, I followed you to your door, and so made sure that I was
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: really an object of interest to the celebrated Mr. Sherlock
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: Holmes. Then I, rather imprudently, wished you good-night, and
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: started for the Temple to see my husband.
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "We both thought the best resource was flight, when pursued by
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: so formidable an antagonist; so you will find the nest empty when
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: you call to-morrow. As to the photograph, your client may rest in
story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: peace. I love and am loved by a better man than he. The King may

text: time. Mr. Windibank draws my interest every quarter and pays it
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: over to mother, and I find that I can do pretty well with what I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: earn at typewriting. It brings me twopence a sheet, and I can
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: often do from fifteen to twenty sheets in a day."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "You have made your position very clear to me," said Holmes.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "This is my friend, Dr. Watson, before whom you can speak as
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: freely as before myself. Kindly tell us now all about your
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: connection with Mr. Hosmer Angel."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: A flush stole over Miss Sutherland's face, and she picked
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: nervously at the fringe of her jacket. "I met him first at the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: gasfitters' ball," she said. "They used to send father tickets
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: when he was alive, and then afterwards they remembered us, and
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: sent them to mother. Mr. Windibank did not wish us to go. He
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: never did wish us to go anywhere. He would get quite mad if I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: wanted so much as to join a Sunday-school treat. But this time I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: was set on going, and I would go; for what right had he to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: prevent? He said the folk were not fit for us to know, when all
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: father's friends were to be there. And he said that I had nothing
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: fit to wear, when I had my purple plush that I had never so much
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: as taken out of the drawer. At last, when nothing else would do,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: he went off to France upon the business of the firm, but we went,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: mother and I, with Mr. Hardy, who used to be our foreman, and it
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: was there I met Mr. Hosmer Angel."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "I suppose," said Holmes, "that when Mr. Windibank came back from
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: France he was very annoyed at your having gone to the ball."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Oh, well, he was very good about it. He laughed, I remember, and
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: shrugged his shoulders, and said there was no use denying
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: anything to a woman, for she would have her way."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "I see. Then at the gasfitters' ball you met, as I understand, a
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: gentleman called Mr. Hosmer Angel."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Yes, sir. I met him that night, and he called next day to ask if
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: we had got home all safe, and after that we met him--that is to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: say, Mr. Holmes, I met him twice for walks, but after that father
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: came back again, and Mr. Hosmer Angel could not come to the house
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: any more."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "No?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Well, you know father didn't like anything of the sort. He
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: wouldn't have any visitors if he could help it, and he used to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: say that a woman should be happy in her own family circle. But
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: then, as I used to say to mother, a woman wants her own circle to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: begin with, and I had not got mine yet."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "But how about Mr. Hosmer Angel? Did he make no attempt to see
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: you?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Well, father was going off to France again in a week, and Hosmer
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: wrote and said that it would be safer and better not to see each
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: other until he had gone. We could write in the meantime, and he
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: used to write every day. I took the letters in in the morning, so
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: there was no need for father to know."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Were you engaged to the gentleman at this time?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Oh, yes, Mr. Holmes. We were engaged after the first walk that
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: we took. Hosmer--Mr. Angel--was a cashier in an office in
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Leadenhall Street--and--"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "What office?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "That's the worst of it, Mr. Holmes, I don't know."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Where did he live, then?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "He slept on the premises."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "And you don't know his address?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "No--except that it was Leadenhall Street."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Where did you address your letters, then?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "To the Leadenhall Street Post Office, to be left till called
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: for. He said that if they were sent to the office he would be
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: chaffed by all the other clerks about having letters from a lady,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: so I offered to typewrite them, like he did his, but he wouldn't
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: have that, for he said that when I wrote them they seemed to come
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: from me, but when they were typewritten he always felt that the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: machine had come between us. That will just show you how fond he
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: was of me, Mr. Holmes, and the little things that he would think
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: of."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "It was most suggestive," said Holmes. "It has long been an axiom
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Can you remember any other little things about Mr. Hosmer Angel?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "He was a very shy man, Mr. Holmes. He would rather walk with me
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: in the evening than in the daylight, for he said that he hated to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: be conspicuous. Very retiring and gentlemanly he was. Even his
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: voice was gentle. He'd had the quinsy and swollen glands when he
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: was young, he told me, and it had left him with a weak throat,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: and a hesitating, whispering fashion of speech. He was always
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: well dressed, very neat and plain, but his eyes were weak, just
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: as mine are, and he wore tinted glasses against the glare."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Well, and what happened when Mr. Windibank, your stepfather,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: returned to France?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Mr. Hosmer Angel came to the house again and proposed that we
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: should marry before father came back. He was in dreadful earnest
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: and made me swear, with my hands on the Testament, that whatever
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: happened I would always be true to him. Mother said he was quite
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: right to make me swear, and that it was a sign of his passion.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Mother was all in his favour from the first and was even fonder
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: of him than I was. Then, when they talked of marrying within the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: week, I began to ask about father; but they both said never to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: mind about father, but just to tell him afterwards, and mother
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: said she would make it all right with him. I didn't quite like
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: that, Mr. Holmes. It seemed funny that I should ask his leave, as
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: he was only a few years older than me; but I didn't want to do
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: anything on the sly, so I wrote to father at Bordeaux, where the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: company has its French offices, but the letter came back to me on
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: the very morning of the wedding."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "It missed him, then?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Yes, sir; for he had started to England just before it arrived."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Ha! that was unfortunate. Your wedding was arranged, then, for
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: the Friday. Was it to be in church?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Yes, sir, but very quietly. It was to be at St. Saviour's, near
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: King's Cross, and we were to have breakfast afterwards at the St.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Pancras Hotel. Hosmer came for us in a hansom, but as there were
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: two of us he put us both into it and stepped himself into a
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: four-wheeler, which happened to be the only other cab in the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: street. We got to the church first, and when the four-wheeler
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: drove up we waited for him to step out, but he never did, and
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: when the cabman got down from the box and looked there was no one
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: there! The cabman said that he could not imagine what had become
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: of him, for he had seen him get in with his own eyes. That was
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: last Friday, Mr. Holmes, and I have never seen or heard anything
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: since then to throw any light upon what became of him."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "It seems to me that you have been very shamefully treated," said
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Holmes.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Oh, no, sir! He was too good and kind to leave me so. Why, all
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: the morning he was saying to me that, whatever happened, I was to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: be true; and that even if something quite unforeseen occurred to
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: separate us, I was always to remember that I was pledged to him,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: and that he would claim his pledge sooner or later. It seemed
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: strange talk for a wedding-morning, but what has happened since
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: gives a meaning to it."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Most certainly it does. Your own opinion is, then, that some
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: unforeseen catastrophe has occurred to him?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Yes, sir. I believe that he foresaw some danger, or else he
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "But you have no notion as to what it could have been?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "None."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "One more question. How did your mother take the matter?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "She was angry, and said that I was never to speak of the matter
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: again."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "And your father? Did you tell him?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Yes; and he seemed to think, with me, that something had
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: happened, and that I should hear of Hosmer again. As he said,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: what interest could anyone have in bringing me to the doors of
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: the church, and then leaving me? Now, if he had borrowed my
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: money, or if he had married me and got my money settled on him,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: there might be some reason, but Hosmer was very independent about
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: money and never would look at a shilling of mine. And yet, what
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: could have happened? And why could he not write? Oh, it drives me
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: half-mad to think of it, and I can't sleep a wink at night." She
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: heavily into it.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: dwell upon it further. Above all, try to let Mr. Hosmer Angel
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Then you don't think I'll see him again?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "I fear not."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Then what has happened to him?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "You will leave that question in my hands. I should like an
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: accurate description of him and any letters of his which you can
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: spare."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Here is the slip and here are four letters from him."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Thank you. And your address?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "No. 31 Lyon Place, Camberwell."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Mr. Angel's address you never had, I understand. Where is your
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: father's place of business?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "He travels for Westhouse & Marbank, the great claret importers

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Thank you. You have made your statement very clearly. You will

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
