text: ends on a gallows. The case has, in some respects, been not
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: entirely devoid of interest."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "I cannot now entirely see all the steps of your reasoning," I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: remarked.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Well, of course it was obvious from the first that this Mr.
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Hosmer Angel must have some strong object for his curious
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: conduct, and it was equally clear that the only man who really
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: profited by the incident, as far as we could see, was the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: stepfather. Then the fact that the two men were never together,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: but that the one always appeared when the other was away, was
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: suggestive. So were the tinted spectacles and the curious voice,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: which both hinted at a disguise, as did the bushy whiskers. My
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: suspicions were all confirmed by his peculiar action in
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: typewriting his signature, which, of course, inferred that his
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: handwriting was so familiar to her that she would recognise even
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: the smallest sample of it. You see all these isolated facts,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: together with many minor ones, all pointed in the same
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: direction."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "And how did you verify them?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "Having once spotted my man, it was easy to get corroboration. I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: knew the firm for which this man worked. Having taken the printed
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: description. I eliminated everything from it which could be the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: result of a disguise--the whiskers, the glasses, the voice, and I
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: sent it to the firm, with a request that they would inform me
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: whether it answered to the description of any of their
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: travellers. I had already noticed the peculiarities of the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: typewriter, and I wrote to the man himself at his business
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: address asking him if he would come here. As I expected, his
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: reply was typewritten and revealed the same trivial but
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: characteristic defects. The same post brought me a letter from
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Westhouse & Marbank, of Fenchurch Street, to say that the
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: description tallied in every respect with that of their employe,
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: James Windibank. Voila tout!"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "And Miss Sutherland?"
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: "If I tell her she will not believe me. You may remember the old
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: Persian saying, 'There is danger for him who taketh the tiger
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: cub, and danger also for whoso snatches a delusion from a woman.'
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: There is as much sense in Hafiz as in Horace, and as much
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: knowledge of the world."
story: ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY
ADVENTURE III. A CASE OF IDENTITY

text: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: We were seated at breakfast one morning, my wife and I, when the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: maid brought in a telegram. It was from Sherlock Holmes and ran
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: in this way:
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Have you a couple of days to spare? Have just been wired for from
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the west of England in connection with Boscombe Valley tragedy.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Shall be glad if you will come with me. Air and scenery perfect.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Leave Paddington by the 11:15."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "What do you say, dear?" said my wife, looking across at me.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Will you go?"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I really don't know what to say. I have a fairly long list at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: present."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Oh, Anstruther would do your work for you. You have been looking
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: a little pale lately. I think that the change would do you good,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and you are always so interested in Mr. Sherlock Holmes' cases."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I should be ungrateful if I were not, seeing what I gained
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: through one of them," I answered. "But if I am to go, I must pack
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: at once, for I have only half an hour."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: My experience of camp life in Afghanistan had at least had the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: effect of making me a prompt and ready traveller. My wants were
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: few and simple, so that in less than the time stated I was in a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: cab with my valise, rattling away to Paddington Station. Sherlock
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Holmes was pacing up and down the platform, his tall, gaunt
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: figure made even gaunter and taller by his long grey
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: travelling-cloak and close-fitting cloth cap.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It is really very good of you to come, Watson," said he. "It
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: makes a considerable difference to me, having someone with me on
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: whom I can thoroughly rely. Local aid is always either worthless
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: or else biassed. If you will keep the two corner seats I shall
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: get the tickets."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: We had the carriage to ourselves save for an immense litter of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: papers which Holmes had brought with him. Among these he rummaged
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and read, with intervals of note-taking and of meditation, until
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: we were past Reading. Then he suddenly rolled them all into a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: gigantic ball and tossed them up onto the rack.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Have you heard anything of the case?" he asked.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Not a word. I have not seen a paper for some days."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "The London press has not had very full accounts. I have just
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: been looking through all the recent papers in order to master the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: particulars. It seems, from what I gather, to be one of those
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: simple cases which are so extremely difficult."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "That sounds a little paradoxical."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "But it is profoundly true. Singularity is almost invariably a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: clue. The more featureless and commonplace a crime is, the more
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: difficult it is to bring it home. In this case, however, they
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: have established a very serious case against the son of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: murdered man."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It is a murder, then?"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Well, it is conjectured to be so. I shall take nothing for
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: granted until I have the opportunity of looking personally into
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: it. I will explain the state of things to you, as far as I have
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: been able to understand it, in a very few words.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Boscombe Valley is a country district not very far from Ross, in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Herefordshire. The largest landed proprietor in that part is a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Mr. John Turner, who made his money in Australia and returned
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: some years ago to the old country. One of the farms which he
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: held, that of Hatherley, was let to Mr. Charles McCarthy, who was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: also an ex-Australian. The men had known each other in the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: colonies, so that it was not unnatural that when they came to
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: settle down they should do so as near each other as possible.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Turner was apparently the richer man, so McCarthy became his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: tenant but still remained, it seems, upon terms of perfect
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: equality, as they were frequently together. McCarthy had one son,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: a lad of eighteen, and Turner had an only daughter of the same
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: age, but neither of them had wives living. They appear to have
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: avoided the society of the neighbouring English families and to
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: have led retired lives, though both the McCarthys were fond of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: sport and were frequently seen at the race-meetings of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: neighbourhood. McCarthy kept two servants--a man and a girl.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Turner had a considerable household, some half-dozen at the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: least. That is as much as I have been able to gather about the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: families. Now for the facts.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "On June 3rd, that is, on Monday last, McCarthy left his house at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Hatherley about three in the afternoon and walked down to the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Boscombe Pool, which is a small lake formed by the spreading out
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: of the stream which runs down the Boscombe Valley. He had been
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: out with his serving-man in the morning at Ross, and he had told
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the man that he must hurry, as he had an appointment of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: importance to keep at three. From that appointment he never came
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: back alive.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "From Hatherley Farm-house to the Boscombe Pool is a quarter of a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: mile, and two people saw him as he passed over this ground. One
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: was an old woman, whose name is not mentioned, and the other was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: William Crowder, a game-keeper in the employ of Mr. Turner. Both
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: these witnesses depose that Mr. McCarthy was walking alone. The
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: game-keeper adds that within a few minutes of his seeing Mr.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: McCarthy pass he had seen his son, Mr. James McCarthy, going the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: same way with a gun under his arm. To the best of his belief, the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: father was actually in sight at the time, and the son was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: following him. He thought no more of the matter until he heard in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the evening of the tragedy that had occurred.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "The two McCarthys were seen after the time when William Crowder,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the game-keeper, lost sight of them. The Boscombe Pool is thickly
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: wooded round, with just a fringe of grass and of reeds round the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: edge. A girl of fourteen, Patience Moran, who is the daughter of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the lodge-keeper of the Boscombe Valley estate, was in one of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: woods picking flowers. She states that while she was there she
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: saw, at the border of the wood and close by the lake, Mr.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: McCarthy and his son, and that they appeared to be having a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: violent quarrel. She heard Mr. McCarthy the elder using very
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: strong language to his son, and she saw the latter raise up his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: hand as if to strike his father. She was so frightened by their
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: violence that she ran away and told her mother when she reached
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: home that she had left the two McCarthys quarrelling near
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Boscombe Pool, and that she was afraid that they were going to
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: fight. She had hardly said the words when young Mr. McCarthy came
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: running up to the lodge to say that he had found his father dead
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: in the wood, and to ask for the help of the lodge-keeper. He was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: much excited, without either his gun or his hat, and his right
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: hand and sleeve were observed to be stained with fresh blood. On
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: following him they found the dead body stretched out upon the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: grass beside the pool. The head had been beaten in by repeated
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: blows of some heavy and blunt weapon. The injuries were such as
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: might very well have been inflicted by the butt-end of his son's
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: gun, which was found lying on the grass within a few paces of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: body. Under these circumstances the young man was instantly
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: arrested, and a verdict of 'wilful murder' having been returned
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: at the inquest on Tuesday, he was on Wednesday brought before the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: magistrates at Ross, who have referred the case to the next
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Assizes. Those are the main facts of the case as they came out
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: before the coroner and the police-court."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I could hardly imagine a more damning case," I remarked. "If
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: ever circumstantial evidence pointed to a criminal it does so
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: here."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Circumstantial evidence is a very tricky thing," answered Holmes
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: thoughtfully. "It may seem to point very straight to one thing,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: but if you shift your own point of view a little, you may find it
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: pointing in an equally uncompromising manner to something
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: entirely different. It must be confessed, however, that the case
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: looks exceedingly grave against the young man, and it is very
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: possible that he is indeed the culprit. There are several people
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: in the neighbourhood, however, and among them Miss Turner, the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: daughter of the neighbouring landowner, who believe in his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: innocence, and who have retained Lestrade, whom you may recollect
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: in connection with the Study in Scarlet, to work out the case in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: his interest. Lestrade, being rather puzzled, has referred the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: case to me, and hence it is that two middle-aged gentlemen are
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: flying westward at fifty miles an hour instead of quietly
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: digesting their breakfasts at home."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I am afraid," said I, "that the facts are so obvious that you
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: will find little credit to be gained out of this case."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact," he
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: answered, laughing. "Besides, we may chance to hit upon some
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: other obvious facts which may have been by no means obvious to
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Mr. Lestrade. You know me too well to think that I am boasting
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: when I say that I shall either confirm or destroy his theory by
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: means which he is quite incapable of employing, or even of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: understanding. To take the first example to hand, I very clearly
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: perceive that in your bedroom the window is upon the right-hand
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: side, and yet I question whether Mr. Lestrade would have noted
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: even so self-evident a thing as that."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "How on earth--"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "My dear fellow, I know you well. I know the military neatness
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: which characterises you. You shave every morning, and in this
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: season you shave by the sunlight; but since your shaving is less
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and less complete as we get farther back on the left side, until
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: it becomes positively slovenly as we get round the angle of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: jaw, it is surely very clear that that side is less illuminated
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: than the other. I could not imagine a man of your habits looking
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: at himself in an equal light and being satisfied with such a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: result. I only quote this as a trivial example of observation and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: inference. Therein lies my metier, and it is just possible that
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: it may be of some service in the investigation which lies before
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: us. There are one or two minor points which were brought out in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the inquest, and which are worth considering."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "What are they?"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It appears that his arrest did not take place at once, but after
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the return to Hatherley Farm. On the inspector of constabulary
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: informing him that he was a prisoner, he remarked that he was not
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: surprised to hear it, and that it was no more than his deserts.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: This observation of his had the natural effect of removing any
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: traces of doubt which might have remained in the minds of the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: coroner's jury."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It was a confession," I ejaculated.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "No, for it was followed by a protestation of innocence."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: man, or else as a man of considerable self-restraint and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: firmness. As to his remark about his deserts, it was also not

text: "Mr. James McCarthy, the only son of the deceased, was then called
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and gave evidence as follows: 'I had been away from home for
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: three days at Bristol, and had only just returned upon the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: morning of last Monday, the 3rd. My father was absent from home at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the time of my arrival, and I was informed by the maid that he
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: had driven over to Ross with John Cobb, the groom. Shortly after
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: my return I heard the wheels of his trap in the yard, and,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: looking out of my window, I saw him get out and walk rapidly out
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: of the yard, though I was not aware in which direction he was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: going. I then took my gun and strolled out in the direction of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the Boscombe Pool, with the intention of visiting the rabbit
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: warren which is upon the other side. On my way I saw William
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Crowder, the game-keeper, as he had stated in his evidence; but
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: he is mistaken in thinking that I was following my father. I had
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: no idea that he was in front of me. When about a hundred yards
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: from the pool I heard a cry of "Cooee!" which was a usual signal
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: between my father and myself. I then hurried forward, and found
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: him standing by the pool. He appeared to be much surprised at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: seeing me and asked me rather roughly what I was doing there. A
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: conversation ensued which led to high words and almost to blows,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: for my father was a man of a very violent temper. Seeing that his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: passion was becoming ungovernable, I left him and returned
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: towards Hatherley Farm. I had not gone more than 150 yards,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: however, when I heard a hideous outcry behind me, which caused me
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: to run back again. I found my father expiring upon the ground,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: with his head terribly injured. I dropped my gun and held him in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: my arms, but he almost instantly expired. I knelt beside him for
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: some minutes, and then made my way to Mr. Turner's lodge-keeper,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: his house being the nearest, to ask for assistance. I saw no one
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: near my father when I returned, and I have no idea how he came by
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: his injuries. He was not a popular man, being somewhat cold and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: forbidding in his manners, but he had, as far as I know, no
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: active enemies. I know nothing further of the matter.'

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: he died?

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: allusion to a rat.

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: delirious.

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "The Coroner: I am afraid that I must press it.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Witness: I must still refuse.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "The Coroner: I understand that the cry of 'Cooee' was a common
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: signal between you and your father?
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Witness: It was.

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "The Coroner: How was it, then, that he uttered it before he saw
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: McCarthy's innocence.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: that he was averse to a marriage with so charming a young lady as

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Ah, thereby hangs a rather painful tale. This fellow is madly,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and his father, who was by all accounts a very hard man, would

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: that he has suffered."

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Yes," said Holmes, answering the look rather than the words. "It
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: is so. I know all about McCarthy."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: The old man sank his face in his hands. "God help me!" he cried.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "But I would not have let the young man come to harm. I give you
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: my word that I would have spoken out if it went against him at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the Assizes."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I am glad to hear you say so," said Holmes gravely.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I would have spoken now had it not been for my dear girl. It
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: would break her heart--it will break her heart when she hears
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: that I am arrested."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It may not come to that," said Holmes.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "What?"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I am no official agent. I understand that it was your daughter
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: who required my presence here, and I am acting in her interests.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Young McCarthy must be got off, however."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I am a dying man," said old Turner. "I have had diabetes for
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: years. My doctor says it is a question whether I shall live a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: month. Yet I would rather die under my own roof than in a gaol."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Holmes rose and sat down at the table with his pen in his hand
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and a bundle of paper before him. "Just tell us the truth," he
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: said. "I shall jot down the facts. You will sign it, and Watson
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: here can witness it. Then I could produce your confession at the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: last extremity to save young McCarthy. I promise you that I shall
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: not use it unless it is absolutely needed."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It's as well," said the old man; "it's a question whether I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: shall live to the Assizes, so it matters little to me, but I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: should wish to spare Alice the shock. And now I will make the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: thing clear to you; it has been a long time in the acting, but
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: will not take me long to tell.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "You didn't know this dead man, McCarthy. He was a devil
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: incarnate. I tell you that. God keep you out of the clutches of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: such a man as he. His grip has been upon me these twenty years,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and he has blasted my life. I'll tell you first how I came to be
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: in his power.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "It was in the early '60's at the diggings. I was a young chap
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: then, hot-blooded and reckless, ready to turn my hand at
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: anything; I got among bad companions, took to drink, had no luck
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: with my claim, took to the bush, and in a word became what you
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: would call over here a highway robber. There were six of us, and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: we had a wild, free life of it, sticking up a station from time
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: to time, or stopping the wagons on the road to the diggings.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Black Jack of Ballarat was the name I went under, and our party
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: is still remembered in the colony as the Ballarat Gang.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "One day a gold convoy came down from Ballarat to Melbourne, and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: we lay in wait for it and attacked it. There were six troopers
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and six of us, so it was a close thing, but we emptied four of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: their saddles at the first volley. Three of our boys were killed,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: however, before we got the swag. I put my pistol to the head of
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the wagon-driver, who was this very man McCarthy. I wish to the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Lord that I had shot him then, but I spared him, though I saw his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: wicked little eyes fixed on my face, as though to remember every
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: feature. We got away with the gold, became wealthy men, and made
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: our way over to England without being suspected. There I parted
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: from my old pals and determined to settle down to a quiet and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: respectable life. I bought this estate, which chanced to be in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the market, and I set myself to do a little good with my money,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: to make up for the way in which I had earned it. I married, too,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and though my wife died young she left me my dear little Alice.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Even when she was just a baby her wee hand seemed to lead me down
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: the right path as nothing else had ever done. In a word, I turned
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: over a new leaf and did my best to make up for the past. All was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: going well when McCarthy laid his grip upon me.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I had gone up to town about an investment, and I met him in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Regent Street with hardly a coat to his back or a boot to his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: foot.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "'Here we are, Jack,' says he, touching me on the arm; 'we'll be
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: as good as a family to you. There's two of us, me and my son, and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: you can have the keeping of us. If you don't--it's a fine,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: law-abiding country is England, and there's always a policeman
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: within hail.'
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Well, down they came to the west country, there was no shaking
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: them off, and there they have lived rent free on my best land
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: ever since. There was no rest for me, no peace, no forgetfulness;
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: turn where I would, there was his cunning, grinning face at my
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: elbow. It grew worse as Alice grew up, for he soon saw I was more
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: afraid of her knowing my past than of the police. Whatever he
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: wanted he must have, and whatever it was I gave him without
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: question, land, money, houses, until at last he asked a thing
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: which I could not give. He asked for Alice.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "His son, you see, had grown up, and so had my girl, and as I was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: known to be in weak health, it seemed a fine stroke to him that
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: his lad should step into the whole property. But there I was
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: firm. I would not have his cursed stock mixed with mine; not that
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: I had any dislike to the lad, but his blood was in him, and that
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: was enough. I stood firm. McCarthy threatened. I braved him to do
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: his worst. We were to meet at the pool midway between our houses
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: to talk it over.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "When I went down there I found him talking with his son, so I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: smoked a cigar and waited behind a tree until he should be alone.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: But as I listened to his talk all that was black and bitter in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: me seemed to come uppermost. He was urging his son to marry my
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: daughter with as little regard for what she might think as if she
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: were a slut from off the streets. It drove me mad to think that I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: and all that I held most dear should be in the power of such a
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: man as this. Could I not snap the bond? I was already a dying and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: a desperate man. Though clear of mind and fairly strong of limb,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: I knew that my own fate was sealed. But my memory and my girl!
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Both could be saved if I could but silence that foul tongue. I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: did it, Mr. Holmes. I would do it again. Deeply as I have sinned,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: I have led a life of martyrdom to atone for it. But that my girl
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: should be entangled in the same meshes which held me was more
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: than I could suffer. I struck him down with no more compunction
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: than if he had been some foul and venomous beast. His cry brought
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: back his son; but I had gained the cover of the wood, though I
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: was forced to go back to fetch the cloak which I had dropped in
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: my flight. That is the true story, gentlemen, of all that
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: occurred."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Well, it is not for me to judge you," said Holmes as the old man
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: signed the statement which had been drawn out. "I pray that we
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: may never be exposed to such a temptation."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I pray not, sir. And what do you intend to do?"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "In view of your health, nothing. You are yourself aware that you
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: will soon have to answer for your deed at a higher court than the
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Assizes. I will keep your confession, and if McCarthy is
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: condemned I shall be forced to use it. If not, it shall never be
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: seen by mortal eye; and your secret, whether you be alive or
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: dead, shall be safe with us."
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Farewell, then," said the old man solemnly. "Your own deathbeds,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: when they come, will be the easier for the thought of the peace
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: which you have given to mine." Tottering and shaking in all his
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: giant frame, he stumbled slowly from the room.
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "God help us!" said Holmes after a long silence. "Why does fate
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: play such tricks with poor, helpless worms? I never hear of such
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: a case as this that I do not think of Baxter's words, and say,
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: 'There, but for the grace of God, goes Sherlock Holmes.'"
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: number of objections which had been drawn out by Holmes and
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: submitted to the defending counsel. Old Turner lived for seven
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: months after our interview, but he is now dead; and there is
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: every prospect that the son and daughter may come to live happily
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: together in ignorance of the black cloud which rests upon their
story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: past.

text: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: When I glance over my notes and records of the Sherlock Holmes
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: cases between the years '82 and '90, I am faced by so many which
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: present strange and interesting features that it is no easy
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: matter to know which to choose and which to leave. Some, however,
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: have already gained publicity through the papers, and others have
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: not offered a field for those peculiar qualities which my friend
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: possessed in so high a degree, and which it is the object of
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: these papers to illustrate. Some, too, have baffled his
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: analytical skill, and would be, as narratives, beginnings without
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: an ending, while others have been but partially cleared up, and
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: have their explanations founded rather upon conjecture and
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: surmise than on that absolute logical proof which was so dear to
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: him. There is, however, one of these last which was so remarkable
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: in its details and so startling in its results that I am tempted
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: to give some account of it in spite of the fact that there are
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: points in connection with it which never have been, and probably
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: never will be, entirely cleared up.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: The year '87 furnished us with a long series of cases of greater
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: or less interest, of which I retain the records. Among my
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: headings under this one twelve months I find an account of the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: adventure of the Paradol Chamber, of the Amateur Mendicant
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Society, who held a luxurious club in the lower vault of a
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: furniture warehouse, of the facts connected with the loss of the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: British barque "Sophy Anderson", of the singular adventures of the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Grice Patersons in the island of Uffa, and finally of the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Camberwell poisoning case. In the latter, as may be remembered,
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Sherlock Holmes was able, by winding up the dead man's watch, to
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: prove that it had been wound up two hours before, and that
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: therefore the deceased had gone to bed within that time--a
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: deduction which was of the greatest importance in clearing up the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: case. All these I may sketch out at some future date, but none of
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: them present such singular features as the strange train of
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: circumstances which I have now taken up my pen to describe.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: It was in the latter days of September, and the equinoctial gales
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: had set in with exceptional violence. All day the wind had
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: screamed and the rain had beaten against the windows, so that
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: even here in the heart of great, hand-made London we were forced
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: to raise our minds for the instant from the routine of life and
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: to recognise the presence of those great elemental forces which
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: shriek at mankind through the bars of his civilisation, like
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: untamed beasts in a cage. As evening drew in, the storm grew
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: higher and louder, and the wind cried and sobbed like a child in
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: the chimney. Sherlock Holmes sat moodily at one side of the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: fireplace cross-indexing his records of crime, while I at the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: other was deep in one of Clark Russell's fine sea-stories until
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: the howl of the gale from without seemed to blend with the text,
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: and the splash of the rain to lengthen out into the long swash of
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: the sea waves. My wife was on a visit to her mother's, and for a
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: few days I was a dweller once more in my old quarters at Baker
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Street.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "Why," said I, glancing up at my companion, "that was surely the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: bell. Who could come to-night? Some friend of yours, perhaps?"
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "Except yourself I have none," he answered. "I do not encourage
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: visitors."
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "A client, then?"
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "If so, it is a serious case. Nothing less would bring a man out
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: on such a day and at such an hour. But I take it that it is more
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: likely to be some crony of the landlady's."
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: Sherlock Holmes was wrong in his conjecture, however, for there
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: came a step in the passage and a tapping at the door. He
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: stretched out his long arm to turn the lamp away from himself and
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: towards the vacant chair upon which a newcomer must sit.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "Come in!" said he.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: The man who entered was young, some two-and-twenty at the
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: outside, well-groomed and trimly clad, with something of
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: which he held in his hand, and his long shining waterproof told
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: of the fierce weather through which he had come. He looked about
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: him anxiously in the glare of the lamp, and I could see that his
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: face was pale and his eyes heavy, like those of a man who is
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: weighed down with some great anxiety.
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "I owe you an apology," he said, raising his golden pince-nez to
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: his eyes. "I trust that I am not intruding. I fear that I have
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: brought some traces of the storm and rain into your snug
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: chamber."
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: "Give me your coat and umbrella," said Holmes. "They may rest
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: here on the hook and will be dry presently. You have come up from
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS

text: the south-west, I see."
story: ADVENTURE V. THE FIVE ORANGE PIPS
