text: "My dear fellow, I would not miss it for anything."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: I had no keener pleasure than in following Holmes in his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: professional investigations, and in admiring the rapid
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: deductions, as swift as intuitions, and yet always founded on a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: logical basis with which he unravelled the problems which were
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: submitted to him. I rapidly threw on my clothes and was ready in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a few minutes to accompany my friend down to the sitting-room. A
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: lady dressed in black and heavily veiled, who had been sitting in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the window, rose as we entered.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Good-morning, madam," said Holmes cheerily. "My name is Sherlock
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Holmes. This is my intimate friend and associate, Dr. Watson,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: before whom you can speak as freely as before myself. Ha! I am
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: glad to see that Mrs. Hudson has had the good sense to light the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: fire. Pray draw up to it, and I shall order you a cup of hot
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: coffee, for I observe that you are shivering."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "It is not cold which makes me shiver," said the woman in a low
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: voice, changing her seat as requested.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "What, then?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "It is fear, Mr. Holmes. It is terror." She raised her veil as
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: she spoke, and we could see that she was indeed in a pitiable
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: state of agitation, her face all drawn and grey, with restless
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: frightened eyes, like those of some hunted animal. Her features
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and figure were those of a woman of thirty, but her hair was shot
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: with premature grey, and her expression was weary and haggard.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Sherlock Holmes ran her over with one of his quick,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: all-comprehensive glances.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You must not fear," said he soothingly, bending forward and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: patting her forearm. "We shall soon set matters right, I have no
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: doubt. You have come in by train this morning, I see."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You know me, then?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "No, but I observe the second half of a return ticket in the palm
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: of your left glove. You must have started early, and yet you had
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a good drive in a dog-cart, along heavy roads, before you reached
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the station."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: The lady gave a violent start and stared in bewilderment at my
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: companion.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "There is no mystery, my dear madam," said he, smiling. "The left
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: arm of your jacket is spattered with mud in no less than seven
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: places. The marks are perfectly fresh. There is no vehicle save a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: dog-cart which throws up mud in that way, and then only when you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sit on the left-hand side of the driver."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Whatever your reasons may be, you are perfectly correct," said
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: she. "I started from home before six, reached Leatherhead at
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: twenty past, and came in by the first train to Waterloo. Sir, I
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: can stand this strain no longer; I shall go mad if it continues.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: I have no one to turn to--none, save only one, who cares for me,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and he, poor fellow, can be of little aid. I have heard of you,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Mr. Holmes; I have heard of you from Mrs. Farintosh, whom you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: helped in the hour of her sore need. It was from her that I had
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: your address. Oh, sir, do you not think that you could help me,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: too, and at least throw a little light through the dense darkness
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: which surrounds me? At present it is out of my power to reward
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: you for your services, but in a month or six weeks I shall be
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: married, with the control of my own income, and then at least you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: shall not find me ungrateful."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Holmes turned to his desk and, unlocking it, drew out a small
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: case-book, which he consulted.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Farintosh," said he. "Ah yes, I recall the case; it was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: concerned with an opal tiara. I think it was before your time,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Watson. I can only say, madam, that I shall be happy to devote
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the same care to your case as I did to that of your friend. As to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: reward, my profession is its own reward; but you are at liberty
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to defray whatever expenses I may be put to, at the time which
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: suits you best. And now I beg that you will lay before us
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: everything that may help us in forming an opinion upon the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: matter."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Alas!" replied our visitor, "the very horror of my situation
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: lies in the fact that my fears are so vague, and my suspicions
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: depend so entirely upon small points, which might seem trivial to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: another, that even he to whom of all others I have a right to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: look for help and advice looks upon all that I tell him about it
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: as the fancies of a nervous woman. He does not say so, but I can
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: read it from his soothing answers and averted eyes. But I have
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: heard, Mr. Holmes, that you can see deeply into the manifold
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: wickedness of the human heart. You may advise me how to walk amid
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the dangers which encompass me."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I am all attention, madam."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "My name is Helen Stoner, and I am living with my stepfather, who
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: is the last survivor of one of the oldest Saxon families in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: England, the Roylotts of Stoke Moran, on the western border of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Surrey."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Holmes nodded his head. "The name is familiar to me," said he.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "The family was at one time among the richest in England, and the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: estates extended over the borders into Berkshire in the north,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and Hampshire in the west. In the last century, however, four
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: successive heirs were of a dissolute and wasteful disposition,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and the family ruin was eventually completed by a gambler in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: days of the Regency. Nothing was left save a few acres of ground,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and the two-hundred-year-old house, which is itself crushed under
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a heavy mortgage. The last squire dragged out his existence
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: there, living the horrible life of an aristocratic pauper; but
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: his only son, my stepfather, seeing that he must adapt himself to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the new conditions, obtained an advance from a relative, which
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: enabled him to take a medical degree and went out to Calcutta,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: where, by his professional skill and his force of character, he
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: established a large practice. In a fit of anger, however, caused
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: by some robberies which had been perpetrated in the house, he
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: beat his native butler to death and narrowly escaped a capital
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sentence. As it was, he suffered a long term of imprisonment and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: afterwards returned to England a morose and disappointed man.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "When Dr. Roylott was in India he married my mother, Mrs. Stoner,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the young widow of Major-General Stoner, of the Bengal Artillery.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: My sister Julia and I were twins, and we were only two years old
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: at the time of my mother's re-marriage. She had a considerable
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sum of money--not less than 1000 pounds a year--and this she
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: bequeathed to Dr. Roylott entirely while we resided with him,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: with a provision that a certain annual sum should be allowed to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: each of us in the event of our marriage. Shortly after our return
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to England my mother died--she was killed eight years ago in a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: railway accident near Crewe. Dr. Roylott then abandoned his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: attempts to establish himself in practice in London and took us
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to live with him in the old ancestral house at Stoke Moran. The
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: money which my mother had left was enough for all our wants, and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: there seemed to be no obstacle to our happiness.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "But a terrible change came over our stepfather about this time.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Instead of making friends and exchanging visits with our
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: neighbours, who had at first been overjoyed to see a Roylott of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Stoke Moran back in the old family seat, he shut himself up in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: his house and seldom came out save to indulge in ferocious
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: quarrels with whoever might cross his path. Violence of temper
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: approaching to mania has been hereditary in the men of the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: family, and in my stepfather's case it had, I believe, been
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: intensified by his long residence in the tropics. A series of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: disgraceful brawls took place, two of which ended in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: police-court, until at last he became the terror of the village,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and the folks would fly at his approach, for he is a man of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: immense strength, and absolutely uncontrollable in his anger.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Last week he hurled the local blacksmith over a parapet into a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: stream, and it was only by paying over all the money which I
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: could gather together that I was able to avert another public
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: exposure. He had no friends at all save the wandering gipsies,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and he would give these vagabonds leave to encamp upon the few
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: acres of bramble-covered land which represent the family estate,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and would accept in return the hospitality of their tents,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: wandering away with them sometimes for weeks on end. He has a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: passion also for Indian animals, which are sent over to him by a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: correspondent, and he has at this moment a cheetah and a baboon,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: which wander freely over his grounds and are feared by the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: villagers almost as much as their master.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You can imagine from what I say that my poor sister Julia and I
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: had no great pleasure in our lives. No servant would stay with
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: us, and for a long time we did all the work of the house. She was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: but thirty at the time of her death, and yet her hair had already
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: begun to whiten, even as mine has."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Your sister is dead, then?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "She died just two years ago, and it is of her death that I wish
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to speak to you. You can understand that, living the life which I
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: have described, we were little likely to see anyone of our own
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: age and position. We had, however, an aunt, my mother's maiden
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sister, Miss Honoria Westphail, who lives near Harrow, and we
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: were occasionally allowed to pay short visits at this lady's
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: house. Julia went there at Christmas two years ago, and met there
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a half-pay major of marines, to whom she became engaged. My
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: stepfather learned of the engagement when my sister returned and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: offered no objection to the marriage; but within a fortnight of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the day which had been fixed for the wedding, the terrible event
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: occurred which has deprived me of my only companion."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Sherlock Holmes had been leaning back in his chair with his eyes
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: closed and his head sunk in a cushion, but he half opened his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: lids now and glanced across at his visitor.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Pray be precise as to details," said he.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "It is easy for me to be so, for every event of that dreadful
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: time is seared into my memory. The manor-house is, as I have
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: already said, very old, and only one wing is now inhabited. The
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: bedrooms in this wing are on the ground floor, the sitting-rooms
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: being in the central block of the buildings. Of these bedrooms
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the first is Dr. Roylott's, the second my sister's, and the third
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: my own. There is no communication between them, but they all open
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: out into the same corridor. Do I make myself plain?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Perfectly so."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "The windows of the three rooms open out upon the lawn. That
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: fatal night Dr. Roylott had gone to his room early, though we
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: knew that he had not retired to rest, for my sister was troubled
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: by the smell of the strong Indian cigars which it was his custom
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to smoke. She left her room, therefore, and came into mine, where
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: she sat for some time, chatting about her approaching wedding. At
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: eleven o'clock she rose to leave me, but she paused at the door
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and looked back.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Tell me, Helen,' said she, 'have you ever heard anyone whistle
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: in the dead of the night?'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Never,' said I.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'I suppose that you could not possibly whistle, yourself, in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: your sleep?'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Certainly not. But why?'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Because during the last few nights I have always, about three
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: in the morning, heard a low, clear whistle. I am a light sleeper,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and it has awakened me. I cannot tell where it came from--perhaps
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: from the next room, perhaps from the lawn. I thought that I would
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: just ask you whether you had heard it.'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'No, I have not. It must be those wretched gipsies in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: plantation.'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Very likely. And yet if it were on the lawn, I wonder that you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: did not hear it also.'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Ah, but I sleep more heavily than you.'
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "'Well, it is of no great consequence, at any rate.' She smiled
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: back at me, closed my door, and a few moments later I heard her
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: key turn in the lock."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Indeed," said Holmes. "Was it your custom always to lock
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: yourselves in at night?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Always."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "And why?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I think that I mentioned to you that the doctor kept a cheetah
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and a baboon. We had no feeling of security unless our doors were
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: locked."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Quite so. Pray proceed with your statement."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I could not sleep that night. A vague feeling of impending
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: misfortune impressed me. My sister and I, you will recollect,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: were twins, and you know how subtle are the links which bind two
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: souls which are so closely allied. It was a wild night. The wind
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: was howling outside, and the rain was beating and splashing
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: against the windows. Suddenly, amid all the hubbub of the gale,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: there burst forth the wild scream of a terrified woman. I knew
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that it was my sister's voice. I sprang from my bed, wrapped a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: shawl round me, and rushed into the corridor. As I opened my door
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: I seemed to hear a low whistle, such as my sister described, and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: dreadfully convulsed. At first I thought that she had not
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: recognised me, but as I bent over her she suddenly shrieked out
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: seized her and choked her words. I rushed out, calling loudly for
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: my stepfather, and I met him hastening from his room in his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: dressing-gown. When he reached my sister's side she was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: unconscious, and though he poured brandy down her throat and sent
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: for medical aid from the village, all efforts were in vain, for
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: consciousness. Such was the dreadful end of my beloved sister."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: total income, which at the time of the wife's death was little
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: short of 1100 pounds, is now, through the fall in agricultural
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: prices, not more than 750 pounds. Each daughter can claim an
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: income of 250 pounds, in case of marriage. It is evident,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: therefore, that if both girls had married, this beauty would have
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: had a mere pittance, while even one of them would cripple him to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a very serious extent. My morning's work has not been wasted,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: since it has proved that he has the very strongest motives for
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: standing in the way of anything of the sort. And now, Watson,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: this is too serious for dawdling, especially as the old man is
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: aware that we are interesting ourselves in his affairs; so if you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: are ready, we shall call a cab and drive to Waterloo. I should be
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: very much obliged if you would slip your revolver into your
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: pocket. An Eley's No. 2 is an excellent argument with gentlemen
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: who can twist steel pokers into knots. That and a tooth-brush
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: are, I think, all that we need."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: At Waterloo we were fortunate in catching a train for
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Leatherhead, where we hired a trap at the station inn and drove
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: for four or five miles through the lovely Surrey lanes. It was a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: perfect day, with a bright sun and a few fleecy clouds in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: heavens. The trees and wayside hedges were just throwing out
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: their first green shoots, and the air was full of the pleasant
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: smell of the moist earth. To me at least there was a strange
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: contrast between the sweet promise of the spring and this
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sinister quest upon which we were engaged. My companion sat in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the front of the trap, his arms folded, his hat pulled down over
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: his eyes, and his chin sunk upon his breast, buried in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: deepest thought. Suddenly, however, he started, tapped me on the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: shoulder, and pointed over the meadows.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Look there!" said he.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: A heavily timbered park stretched up in a gentle slope,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: thickening into a grove at the highest point. From amid the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: branches there jutted out the grey gables and high roof-tree of a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: very old mansion.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Stoke Moran?" said he.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Yes, sir, that be the house of Dr. Grimesby Roylott," remarked
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the driver.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "There is some building going on there," said Holmes; "that is
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: where we are going."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "There's the village," said the driver, pointing to a cluster of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: roofs some distance to the left; "but if you want to get to the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: house, you'll find it shorter to get over this stile, and so by
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the foot-path over the fields. There it is, where the lady is
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: walking."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "And the lady, I fancy, is Miss Stoner," observed Holmes, shading
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: his eyes. "Yes, I think we had better do as you suggest."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: We got off, paid our fare, and the trap rattled back on its way
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to Leatherhead.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I thought it as well," said Holmes as we climbed the stile,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "that this fellow should think we had come here as architects, or
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: on some definite business. It may stop his gossip.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Good-afternoon, Miss Stoner. You see that we have been as good as
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: our word."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Our client of the morning had hurried forward to meet us with a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: face which spoke her joy. "I have been waiting so eagerly for
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: you," she cried, shaking hands with us warmly. "All has turned
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: out splendidly. Dr. Roylott has gone to town, and it is unlikely
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that he will be back before evening."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "We have had the pleasure of making the doctor's acquaintance,"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: said Holmes, and in a few words he sketched out what had
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: occurred. Miss Stoner turned white to the lips as she listened.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Good heavens!" she cried, "he has followed me, then."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "So it appears."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "He is so cunning that I never know when I am safe from him. What
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: will he say when he returns?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "He must guard himself, for he may find that there is someone
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: more cunning than himself upon his track. You must lock yourself
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: up from him to-night. If he is violent, we shall take you away to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: your aunt's at Harrow. Now, we must make the best use of our
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: time, so kindly take us at once to the rooms which we are to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: examine."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: The building was of grey, lichen-blotched stone, with a high
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: central portion and two curving wings, like the claws of a crab,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: thrown out on each side. In one of these wings the windows were
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: broken and blocked with wooden boards, while the roof was partly
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: caved in, a picture of ruin. The central portion was in little
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: better repair, but the right-hand block was comparatively modern,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and the blinds in the windows, with the blue smoke curling up
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: from the chimneys, showed that this was where the family resided.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Some scaffolding had been erected against the end wall, and the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: stone-work had been broken into, but there were no signs of any
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: workmen at the moment of our visit. Holmes walked slowly up and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: down the ill-trimmed lawn and examined with deep attention the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: outsides of the windows.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "This, I take it, belongs to the room in which you used to sleep,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the centre one to your sister's, and the one next to the main
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: building to Dr. Roylott's chamber?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Exactly so. But I am now sleeping in the middle one."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Pending the alterations, as I understand. By the way, there does
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: not seem to be any very pressing need for repairs at that end
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: wall."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "There were none. I believe that it was an excuse to move me from
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: my room."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Ah! that is suggestive. Now, on the other side of this narrow
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: wing runs the corridor from which these three rooms open. There
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: are windows in it, of course?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Yes, but very small ones. Too narrow for anyone to pass
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: through."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "As you both locked your doors at night, your rooms were
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: unapproachable from that side. Now, would you have the kindness
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to go into your room and bar your shutters?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Miss Stoner did so, and Holmes, after a careful examination
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: through the open window, endeavoured in every way to force the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: shutter open, but without success. There was no slit through
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: which a knife could be passed to raise the bar. Then with his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: lens he tested the hinges, but they were of solid iron, built
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: firmly into the massive masonry. "Hum!" said he, scratching his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: chin in some perplexity, "my theory certainly presents some
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: difficulties. No one could pass these shutters if they were
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: bolted. Well, we shall see if the inside throws any light upon
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the matter."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: A small side door led into the whitewashed corridor from which
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: chamber, so we passed at once to the second, that in which Miss
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: fate. It was a homely little room, with a low ceiling and a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: gaping fireplace, after the fashion of old country-houses. A
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: left-hand side of the window. These articles, with two small
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: for a square of Wilton carpet in the centre. The boards round and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and discoloured that it may have dated from the original building
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: of the house. Holmes drew one of the chairs into a corner and sat
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Yes, it must be so. Let me explain. I believe that that is the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Yes, that is the Crown."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Very good. Your windows would be visible from there?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Certainly."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You must confine yourself to your room, on pretence of a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: headache, when your stepfather comes back. Then when you hear him
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: retire for the night, you must open the shutters of your window,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: undo the hasp, put your lamp there as a signal to us, and then
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: withdraw quietly with everything which you are likely to want
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: into the room which you used to occupy. I have no doubt that, in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: spite of the repairs, you could manage there for one night."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Oh, yes, easily."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "The rest you will leave in our hands."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "But what will you do?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "We shall spend the night in your room, and we shall investigate
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the cause of this noise which has disturbed you."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I believe, Mr. Holmes, that you have already made up your mind,"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: said Miss Stoner, laying her hand upon my companion's sleeve.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Perhaps I have."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Then, for pity's sake, tell me what was the cause of my sister's
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: death."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I should prefer to have clearer proofs before I speak."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You can at least tell me whether my own thought is correct, and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: if she died from some sudden fright."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "No, I do not think so. I think that there was probably some more
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that threaten you."

text: Sherlock Holmes and I had no difficulty in engaging a bedroom and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sitting-room at the Crown Inn. They were on the upper floor, and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: from our window we could command a view of the avenue gate, and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: of the inhabited wing of Stoke Moran Manor House. At dusk we saw
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the little figure of the lad who drove him. The boy had some
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: slight difficulty in undoing the heavy iron gates, and we heard
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the lamp was lit in one of the sitting-rooms.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Do you know, Watson," said Holmes as we sat together in the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: gathering darkness, "I have really some scruples as to taking you
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: to-night. There is a distinct element of danger."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Can I be of assistance?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Your presence might be invaluable."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Then I shall certainly come."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "It is very kind of you."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You speak of danger. You have evidently seen more in these rooms
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: than was visible to me."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "No, but I fancy that I may have deduced a little more. I imagine
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that you saw all that I did."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I saw nothing remarkable save the bell-rope, and what purpose
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that could answer I confess is more than I can imagine."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "You saw the ventilator, too?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Yes, but I do not think that it is such a very unusual thing to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: have a small opening between two rooms. It was so small that a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: rat could hardly pass through."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I knew that we should find a ventilator before ever we came to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Stoke Moran."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "My dear Holmes!"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Oh, yes, I did. You remember in her statement she said that her
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: suggested at once that there must be a communication between the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: two rooms. It could only be a small one, or it would have been
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: remarked upon at the coroner's inquiry. I deduced a ventilator."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "But what harm can there be in that?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Well, there is at least a curious coincidence of dates. A
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: bed dies. Does not that strike you?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I cannot as yet see any connection."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Did you observe anything very peculiar about that bed?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "No."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: like that before?"
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I cannot say that I have."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "The lady could not move her bed. It must always be in the same
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: relative position to the ventilator and to the rope--or so we may
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: call it, since it was clearly never meant for a bell-pull."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: crime."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: cheerful."

text: and throwing the noose round the reptile's neck he drew it from
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: its horrid perch and, carrying it at arm's length, threw it into
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the iron safe, which he closed upon it.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Such are the true facts of the death of Dr. Grimesby Roylott, of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Stoke Moran. It is not necessary that I should prolong a
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: narrative which has already run to too great a length by telling
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: how we broke the sad news to the terrified girl, how we conveyed
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: her by the morning train to the care of her good aunt at Harrow,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: of how the slow process of official inquiry came to the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: conclusion that the doctor met his fate while indiscreetly
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: playing with a dangerous pet. The little which I had yet to learn
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: of the case was told me by Sherlock Holmes as we travelled back
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: next day.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I had," said he, "come to an entirely erroneous conclusion which
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: shows, my dear Watson, how dangerous it always is to reason from
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: insufficient data. The presence of the gipsies, and the use of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the word 'band,' which was used by the poor girl, no doubt, to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: explain the appearance which she had caught a hurried glimpse of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: by the light of her match, were sufficient to put me upon an
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: entirely wrong scent. I can only claim the merit that I instantly
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: reconsidered my position when, however, it became clear to me
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: that whatever danger threatened an occupant of the room could not
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: come either from the window or the door. My attention was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: speedily drawn, as I have already remarked to you, to this
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: ventilator, and to the bell-rope which hung down to the bed. The
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: discovery that this was a dummy, and that the bed was clamped to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the floor, instantly gave rise to the suspicion that the rope was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: there as a bridge for something passing through the hole and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: coming to the bed. The idea of a snake instantly occurred to me,
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: and when I coupled it with my knowledge that the doctor was
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: furnished with a supply of creatures from India, I felt that I
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: was probably on the right track. The idea of using a form of
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: poison which could not possibly be discovered by any chemical
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: test was just such a one as would occur to a clever and ruthless
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: man who had had an Eastern training. The rapidity with which such
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: a poison would take effect would also, from his point of view, be
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: an advantage. It would be a sharp-eyed coroner, indeed, who could
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: distinguish the two little dark punctures which would show where
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the poison fangs had done their work. Then I thought of the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: whistle. Of course he must recall the snake before the morning
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: light revealed it to the victim. He had trained it, probably by
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the use of the milk which we saw, to return to him when summoned.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: He would put it through this ventilator at the hour that he
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: thought best, with the certainty that it would crawl down the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: rope and land on the bed. It might or might not bite the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: occupant, perhaps she might escape every night for a week, but
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: sooner or later she must fall a victim.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "I had come to these conclusions before ever I had entered his
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: room. An inspection of his chair showed me that he had been in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: the habit of standing on it, which of course would be necessary
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: in order that he should reach the ventilator. The sight of the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: safe, the saucer of milk, and the loop of whipcord were enough to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: finally dispel any doubts which may have remained. The metallic
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: clang heard by Miss Stoner was obviously caused by her stepfather
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: hastily closing the door of his safe upon its terrible occupant.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Having once made up my mind, you know the steps which I took in
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: order to put the matter to the proof. I heard the creature hiss
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: as I have no doubt that you did also, and I instantly lit the
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: light and attacked it."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "With the result of driving it through the ventilator."
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "And also with the result of causing it to turn upon its master
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: at the other side. Some of the blows of my cane came home and
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: roused its snakish temper, so that it flew upon the first person
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: it saw. In this way I am no doubt indirectly responsible for Dr.
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: Grimesby Roylott's death, and I cannot say that it is likely to
story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: weigh very heavily upon my conscience."

text: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: Of all the problems which have been submitted to my friend, Mr.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: Sherlock Holmes, for solution during the years of our intimacy,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: there were only two which I was the means of introducing to his
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: notice--that of Mr. Hatherley's thumb, and that of Colonel
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: Warburton's madness. Of these the latter may have afforded a
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: finer field for an acute and original observer, but the other was
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: so strange in its inception and so dramatic in its details that
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: it may be the more worthy of being placed upon record, even if it
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: gave my friend fewer openings for those deductive methods of
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: reasoning by which he achieved such remarkable results. The story
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: has, I believe, been told more than once in the newspapers, but,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: like all such narratives, its effect is much less striking when
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: set forth en bloc in a single half-column of print than when the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: facts slowly evolve before your own eyes, and the mystery clears
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: gradually away as each new discovery furnishes a step which leads
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: on to the complete truth. At the time the circumstances made a
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: deep impression upon me, and the lapse of two years has hardly
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: served to weaken the effect.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: It was in the summer of '89, not long after my marriage, that the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: events occurred which I am now about to summarise. I had returned
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: to civil practice and had finally abandoned Holmes in his Baker
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: Street rooms, although I continually visited him and occasionally
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: even persuaded him to forgo his Bohemian habits so far as to come
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: and visit us. My practice had steadily increased, and as I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: happened to live at no very great distance from Paddington
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: Station, I got a few patients from among the officials. One of
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: these, whom I had cured of a painful and lingering disease, was
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: never weary of advertising my virtues and of endeavouring to send
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: me on every sufferer over whom he might have any influence.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: One morning, at a little before seven o'clock, I was awakened by
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: the maid tapping at the door to announce that two men had come
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: from Paddington and were waiting in the consulting-room. I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: dressed hurriedly, for I knew by experience that railway cases
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: were seldom trivial, and hastened downstairs. As I descended, my
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: old ally, the guard, came out of the room and closed the door
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: tightly behind him.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "I've got him here," he whispered, jerking his thumb over his
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: shoulder; "he's all right."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "What is it, then?" I asked, for his manner suggested that it was
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: some strange creature which he had caged up in my room.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "It's a new patient," he whispered. "I thought I'd bring him
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: round myself; then he couldn't slip away. There he is, all safe
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: and sound. I must go now, Doctor; I have my dooties, just the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: same as you." And off he went, this trusty tout, without even
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: giving me time to thank him.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: I entered my consulting-room and found a gentleman seated by the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: table. He was quietly dressed in a suit of heather tweed with a
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: soft cloth cap which he had laid down upon my books. Round one of
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: his hands he had a handkerchief wrapped, which was mottled all
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: over with bloodstains. He was young, not more than
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: five-and-twenty, I should say, with a strong, masculine face; but
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: he was exceedingly pale and gave me the impression of a man who
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: was suffering from some strong agitation, which it took all his
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: strength of mind to control.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "I am sorry to knock you up so early, Doctor," said he, "but I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: have had a very serious accident during the night. I came in by
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: train this morning, and on inquiring at Paddington as to where I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: might find a doctor, a worthy fellow very kindly escorted me
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: here. I gave the maid a card, but I see that she has left it upon
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: the side-table."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: I took it up and glanced at it. "Mr. Victor Hatherley, hydraulic
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: engineer, 16A, Victoria Street (3rd floor)." That was the name,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: style, and abode of my morning visitor. "I regret that I have
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: kept you waiting," said I, sitting down in my library-chair. "You
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: are fresh from a night journey, I understand, which is in itself
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: a monotonous occupation."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Oh, my night could not be called monotonous," said he, and
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: laughed. He laughed very heartily, with a high, ringing note,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: leaning back in his chair and shaking his sides. All my medical
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: instincts rose up against that laugh.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Stop it!" I cried; "pull yourself together!" and I poured out
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: some water from a caraffe.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: It was useless, however. He was off in one of those hysterical
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: outbursts which come upon a strong nature when some great crisis
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: is over and gone. Presently he came to himself once more, very
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: weary and pale-looking.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "I have been making a fool of myself," he gasped.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Not at all. Drink this." I dashed some brandy into the water,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: and the colour began to come back to his bloodless cheeks.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "That's better!" said he. "And now, Doctor, perhaps you would
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: kindly attend to my thumb, or rather to the place where my thumb
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: used to be."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: He unwound the handkerchief and held out his hand. It gave even
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: my hardened nerves a shudder to look at it. There were four
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: protruding fingers and a horrid red, spongy surface where the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: thumb should have been. It had been hacked or torn right out from
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: the roots.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Good heavens!" I cried, "this is a terrible injury. It must have
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: bled considerably."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Yes, it did. I fainted when it was done, and I think that I must
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: have been senseless for a long time. When I came to I found that
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: it was still bleeding, so I tied one end of my handkerchief very
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: tightly round the wrist and braced it up with a twig."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Excellent! You should have been a surgeon."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "It is a question of hydraulics, you see, and came within my own
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: province."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "This has been done," said I, examining the wound, "by a very
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: heavy and sharp instrument."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "A thing like a cleaver," said he.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "An accident, I presume?"
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "By no means."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "What! a murderous attack?"
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Very murderous indeed."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "You horrify me."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: I sponged the wound, cleaned it, dressed it, and finally covered
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: it over with cotton wadding and carbolised bandages. He lay back
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: without wincing, though he bit his lip from time to time.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "How is that?" I asked when I had finished.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Capital! Between your brandy and your bandage, I feel a new man.
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: I was very weak, but I have had a good deal to go through."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Perhaps you had better not speak of the matter. It is evidently
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: trying to your nerves."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Oh, no, not now. I shall have to tell my tale to the police;
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: but, between ourselves, if it were not for the convincing
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: evidence of this wound of mine, I should be surprised if they
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: believed my statement, for it is a very extraordinary one, and I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: have not much in the way of proof with which to back it up; and,
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: even if they believe me, the clues which I can give them are so
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: vague that it is a question whether justice will be done."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Ha!" cried I, "if it is anything in the nature of a problem
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: which you desire to see solved, I should strongly recommend you
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: to come to my friend, Mr. Sherlock Holmes, before you go to the
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: official police."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Oh, I have heard of that fellow," answered my visitor, "and I
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: should be very glad if he would take the matter up, though of
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: course I must use the official police as well. Would you give me
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: an introduction to him?"
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "I'll do better. I'll take you round to him myself."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "I should be immensely obliged to you."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "We'll call a cab and go together. We shall just be in time to
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: have a little breakfast with him. Do you feel equal to it?"
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Yes; I shall not feel easy until I have told my story."
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB
IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: "Then my servant will call a cab, and I shall be with you in an
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: instant." I rushed upstairs, explained the matter shortly to my
story: IX. THE ADVENTURE OF THE ENGINEER'S THUMB

text: wife, and in five minutes was inside a hansom, driving with my

text: new acquaintance to Baker Street.
