story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: Toller to bear the news to his wife, I did what I could to
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: relieve his pain. We were all assembled round him when the door
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: opened, and a tall, gaunt woman entered the room.
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Mrs. Toller!" cried Miss Hunter.
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Yes, miss. Mr. Rucastle let me out when he came back before he
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: went up to you. Ah, miss, it is a pity you didn't let me know
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: what you were planning, for I would have told you that your pains
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: were wasted."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Ha!" said Holmes, looking keenly at her. "It is clear that Mrs.
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: Toller knows more about this matter than anyone else."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Yes, sir, I do, and I am ready enough to tell what I know."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Then, pray, sit down, and let us hear it for there are several
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: points on which I must confess that I am still in the dark."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "I will soon make it clear to you," said she; "and I'd have done
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: so before now if I could ha' got out from the cellar. If there's
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: police-court business over this, you'll remember that I was the
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: one that stood your friend, and that I was Miss Alice's friend
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: too.
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "She was never happy at home, Miss Alice wasn't, from the time
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: that her father married again. She was slighted like and had no
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: say in anything, but it never really became bad for her until
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: after she met Mr. Fowler at a friend's house. As well as I could
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: learn, Miss Alice had rights of her own by will, but she was so
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: quiet and patient, she was, that she never said a word about them
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: but just left everything in Mr. Rucastle's hands. He knew he was
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: safe with her; but when there was a chance of a husband coming
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: forward, who would ask for all that the law would give him, then
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: her father thought it time to put a stop on it. He wanted her to
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: sign a paper, so that whether she married or not, he could use
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: her money. When she wouldn't do it, he kept on worrying her until
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: she got brain-fever, and for six weeks was at death's door. Then
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: she got better at last, all worn to a shadow, and with her
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: beautiful hair cut off; but that didn't make no change in her
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: young man, and he stuck to her as true as man could be."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Ah," said Holmes, "I think that what you have been good enough
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: to tell us makes the matter fairly clear, and that I can deduce
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: all that remains. Mr. Rucastle then, I presume, took to this
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: system of imprisonment?"
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Yes, sir."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "And brought Miss Hunter down from London in order to get rid of
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: the disagreeable persistence of Mr. Fowler."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "That was it, sir."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "But Mr. Fowler being a persevering man, as a good seaman should
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: be, blockaded the house, and having met you succeeded by certain
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: interests were the same as his."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "Mr. Fowler was a very kind-spoken, free-handed gentleman," said
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: Mrs. Toller serenely.
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: "And in this way he managed that your good man should have no
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: want of drink, and that a ladder should be ready at the moment
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: when your master had gone out."
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES
XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: And thus was solved the mystery of the sinister house with the
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: copper beeches in front of the door. Mr. Rucastle survived, but
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: was always a broken man, kept alive solely through the care of
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: his devoted wife. They still live with their old servants, who
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: probably know so much of Rucastle's past life that he finds it
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: difficult to part from them. Mr. Fowler and Miss Rucastle were
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: married, by special license, in Southampton the day after their
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: flight, and he is now the holder of a government appointment in
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: the island of Mauritius. As to Miss Violet Hunter, my friend
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: Holmes, rather to my disappointment, manifested no further
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: interest in her when once she had ceased to be the centre of one
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: of his problems, and she is now the head of a private school at
story: XII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE COPPER BEECHES

text: Walsall, where I believe that she has met with considerable success.
